member.name: T:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.GLSL.GLSLProgram
member.summary: Specialisation of HighLevelGpuProgram to provide support for OpenGL Shader Language (GLSL).
member.remarks:
GLSL has no target assembler or entry point specification like DirectX 9 HLSL. Vertex and Fragment shaders only have one entry point called "main". When a shader is compiled, microcode is generated but can not be accessed by the application. GLSL also does not provide assembler low level output after compiling. The GL Render system assumes that the Gpu program is a GL Gpu program so GLSLProgram will create a GLSLGpuProgram that is subclassed from GLGpuProgram for the low level implementation. The GLSLProgram class will create a shader object and compile the source but will not create a program object. It's up to GLSLGpuProgram class to request a program object to link the shader object to.
GLSL supports multiple modular shader objects that can be attached to one program object to form a single shader. This is supported through the "attach" material script command. All the modules to be attached are listed on the same line as the attach command seperated by white space.

member.name: T:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.GLSL.GLSLGpuProgram
member.summary: GLSL low level compiled shader object - this class is used to get at the linked program object and provide an interface for GLRenderSystem calls. GLSL does not provide access to the low level code of the shader so this class is really just a dummy place holder. GLSL uses a program object to represent the active vertex and fragment programs used but Axiom materials maintain seperate instances of the active vertex and fragment programs which creates a small problem for GLSL integration. The GLSLGpuProgram class provides the interface between the GLSLLinkProgramManager , GLRenderSystem, and the active GLSLProgram instances.

member.name: T:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.GLSL.GLSLLinkProgramManager
member.summary: Axiom assumes that there are seperate vertex and fragment programs to deal with but GLSL has one program object that represents the active vertex and fragment shader objects during a rendering state. GLSL Vertex and fragment shader objects are compiled seperately and then attached to a program object and then the program object is linked. Since Ogre can only handle one vertex program and one fragment program being active in a pass, the GLSL Link Program Manager does the same. The GLSL Link program manager acts as a state machine and activates a program object based on the active vertex and fragment program. Previously created program objects are stored along with a unique key in a hash_map for quick retrieval the next time the program object is required.

member.name: T:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass
member.summary: Compiler2Pass is a generic compiler/assembler.
member.remarks:
Provides a tokenizer in pass 1 and relies on the subclass to provide the virtual method for pass 2
PASS 1 - tokenize source: this is a simple brute force lexical scanner/analyzer that also parses the formed token for proper semantics and context in one pass it uses Look Ahead Left-Right (LALR) ruling based on Backus - Naur From notation for semantic checking and also performs context checking allowing for language dialects.
PASS 2 - generate application specific instructions ie native instructions
This class must be subclassed with the subclass providing implementation for Pass 2. The subclass is responsible for setting up the token libraries along with defining the language syntax.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.tokenInstructions
member.summary: Container for tokens extracted from source.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.source
member.summary: Source to be compiled.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.symbolTypeLib
member.summary: Reference to the Text and Token type libraries set up by subclass.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.rootRulePath
member.summary: Reference to the root rule path - has to be set by subclass constructor.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.valueID
member.summary: Needs to be initialized by the subclass before compiling occurs it defines the token ID used in the symbol type library.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.constants
member.summary: Storage container for constants defined in source.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.activeContexts
member.summary: Active Contexts pattern used in pass 1 to determine which tokens are valid for a certain context.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.currentLine
member.summary: Current line in the source string.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.charPos
member.summary: Current position in the source string.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.DoPass1
member.summary: perform pass 1 of compile process
member.remarks: Scans source for symbols that can be tokenized and then performs general semantic and context verification on each symbol before it is tokenized. A tokenized instruction list is built to be used by Pass 2.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.DoPass2
member.summary: Abstract method that must be set up by subclass to perform Pass 2 of compile process

member.summary: Get the text symbol for this token.
member.remarks: Mainly used for debugging and in test routines.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.IsFloatValue(System.Single@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Check to see if the text at the present position in the source is a numerical constant.
member.param: Receives the float value that is in the source.
Receives number of characters that make of the value in the source.
member.returns: True if the characters form a valid float, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.IsSymbol(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Check to see if the text is in the symbol text library.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.PositionToNextSymbol
member.summary: Position to the next possible valid symbol.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.ProcessRulePath(System.Int32)
member.summary: Process input source text using rulepath to determine allowed tokens.
member.remarks:
The method is reentrant and recursive. if a non-terminal token is encountered in the current rule path then the method is called using the new rule path referenced by the non-terminal token Tokens can have the following operation states which effects the flow path of the rule
Rule: defines a rule path for the non-terminal token.
And: the token is required for the rule to pass.
Or: if the previous tokens failed then try these ones.
Optional: the token is optional and does not cause the rule to fail if the token is not found.
Repeat: the token is required but there can be more than one in a sequence.
End: end of the rule path - the method returns the success of the rule.
member.param: Index into to array of Token Rules that define a rule path to be processed.
member.returns: True if rule passed - all required tokens found. False otherwise.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.SetActiveContexts(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Setup ActiveContexts - should be called by subclass to setup initial language contexts.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.SkipComments
member.summary: Skips all comment specifiers.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.SkipEndOfLine
member.summary: Find the end of line marker and move past it.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.SkipWhitespace
member.summary: Skip all the whitespace which includes spaces and tabs.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.ValidateToken(System.Int32,Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Symbol)
member.summary: Check if current position in source has the symbol text equivalent to the TokenID.
member.param: Index into rule path database of token to validate.
Index of non-terminal rule that generated the token.
member.returns: True if token was found. False if token symbol text does not match the source text. If token is non-terminal, then ProcessRulePath is called.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.InitSymbolTypeLib
member.summary: Initialize the type library with matching symbol text found in symbol text library. Find a default text for all Symbol Types in library. Scan through all the rules and initialize TypeLib with index to text and index to rules for non-terminal tokens. Must be called by subclass after libraries and rule database setup.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.Compiler2Pass.Compile(System.String)
member.summary: Compile the source - performs 2 passes: First pass is to tokinize, check semantics and context. Second pass is performed by subclass and converts tokens to application specific instructions.
member.returns: True if Pass 1 and Pass 2 are successful. False if any errors occur in Pass 1 or Pass 2

member.name: T:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.PixelShader
member.summary: Subclasses Compiler2Pass to provide a ps_1_x compiler that takes DirectX pixel shader assembly and converts it to a form that can be used by ATI_fragment_shader OpenGL API.
member.remarks:
All ps_1_1, ps_1_2, ps_1_3, ps_1_4 assembly instructions are recognized but not all are passed on to ATI_fragment_shader. ATI_fragment_shader does not have an equivelant directive for texkill or texdepth instructions.
The user must provide the GL binding interfaces.
A Test method is provided to verify the basic operation of the compiler which outputs the test results to a file.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.PixelShader.texreg2ar
member.summary: Macro token expansion for ps_1_2 instruction: texreg2ar

member.summary: Macro token expansion for ps_1_2 instruction: texreg2gb

member.summary: Macro token expansion for ps_1_1 instruction: texdp3

member.summary: Macro token expansion for ps_1_1 instruction: texdp3

member.summary: Macro token expansion for ps_1_1 instruction: texm3x2tex

member.summary: Macro token expansion for ps_1_1 instruction: texm3x3tex

member.summary: Macro token expansion for ps_1_1 instruction: texm3x3pad

member.summary: Macro token expansion for ps_1_1 instruction: texm3x3spec

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.PixelShader.phase1TEX_mi
member.summary: Machine instructions for phase one texture section.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.PixelShader.phase1ALU_mi
member.summary: Machine instructions for phase one ALU section.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.PixelShader.phase2TEX_mi
member.summary: Machine instructions for phase two texture section.

member.name: F:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.PixelShader.phase2ALU_mi
member.summary: Machine instructions for phase two ALU section.

members.member: keeps track of which registers are written to in each phase if a register is read from but has not been written to in phase 2 then if it was written to in phase 1 perform a register pass function at the begining of phase2 so that the register has something worthwhile in it NB: check ALU and TEX section of phase 1 and phase 2 there are 6 temp registers r0 to r5 to keep track off checks are performed in pass 2 when building machine instructions

attempt to build a machine instruction using current tokens determines what phase machine insturction should be in and if an Alpha Op is required calls expandMachineInstruction() to expand the token into machine instructions
optimizes machine instructions depending on pixel shader context only applies to ps.1.1 ps.1.2 and ps.1.3 since they use CISC instructions that must be transformed into RISC instructions
Build a machine instruction from token and ready it for expansion will expand CISC tokens using macro database
Expand CISC tokens into PS1_4 token equivalents
Expand Machine instruction into operation type and arguments and put into proper machine instruction container also expands scaler alpha machine instructions if required

member.summary: Binds machine instructions generated in Pass 2 to the ATI GL fragment shader.

member.name: M:Axiom.RenderSystems.OpenGL.ATI.PixelShader.DoPass2
member.summary: Pass 1 is completed so now take tokens generated and build machine instructions.
